data.title: fishing hole
data.text: Nothing to write home about for sure, more like a local fishing hole And not great either. How it's called a park is beyond me.

data.title: Live close by.
data.text: My husband and I like going here sometimes after dinner just to walk out on the small pier to catch the cool breeze and unwind. If your like me and don't like the beach sand but still like the beach atmosphere this is the place to go. You can rent out the large pavilion they have or either of the small ones for a kids birthday party, family reunion, etc. It's a smaller park but your right on the water with a small beach area. It's nice to have something like this close to home.

data.title: Very nice plenty of shade great for a lunch picnic
data.text: New water front or modernized not sure but the facilities were clean well maintained peaceful and shady a hard to find goal. This is a diamond in the rough, I will come here when ever i want some relief from the hot hot days in the shade with a nice breeze off the river.

data.title: Nice park to relax your mind
data.text: The park is right off U.S.1 in palm Bay.What i like is you can go for a long walk or just set on a park bench and watch the fisher man or watch the  birds over head working for there dinner or close your eyes and feel the cool breeze from the river.                     P.S.With this new game "Poke man go" now there are a lot of players at this park.

data.title: Postage Stamp Park with great shade, piers, and views
data.text: While we didn't spend any time at this park, it would be a great place to chill out, picnic, read a book, etc.. while looking out over the Indian River. It packs alot in a tiny space and the heavy shade offered by the dense foliage gives a welcome respite from the summer heat

data.title: Good kayaking starting point
data.text: This park is on the Indian river lagoon and is a good spot for fishing, kayaking, paddle boarding. Its easy to access this area right off US 1 and close to the Palm Bay cove and Turkey Creek.

data.title: Great fishing.
data.text: Great docks for fishing and cleaning them as well. Clean rest rooms. Nice wooden walking paths. Picnic tables. Beautiful views.

data.title: nice park with picnic area and restrooms
data.text: Nice park with beautiful views of the river. We saw dolphins in the river and an owl in a tree. Has a nice beach type area for fishing...nice areas for a picnic or bbq.

data.title: great place for a family outing
data.text: great place to take the family for a cookout and fishing for the day. It has restrooms, covered picnic area.  You can watch the dolpins swim and play in the water.  Sometimes there are wind sail out there that are fun to watch also.  It is kept very clean..

data.title: Nice view. Good spot to fish.
data.text: Nice piers for fishing, picnic tables and a fish cleaning station. Also a nice little sandy beach area to relax on.

data.title: Relax at Castaways Point park
data.text: Nice place to fish.  There are a few covered gazeebos. A paved sidewalk to walk along the intra-coastal waterway. Two fishing docks. Small restrooms.  Nice and shady.

data.title: Great Photo Spot
data.text: I love to come here with my camera equipment during the winter months when the park is full of visiting northern birds.  There were more before all the improvements but they still come around.   You see egrets, gulls, ibis, ducks, starlings and Pelicans of course.  It is great to just stand at the fishing pier and talk to the old timers fishing.  The big Sur in California has the lone cypress and Castaways Point has the lone palm.

data.title: Great Little Fishing Spot
data.text: Great little spot to stop by and throw your line in the water for some spur of the moment fishing.  They have 2 piers, gazebo, restrooms

data.title: A Hiddgen gem
data.text: Beautiful quite place to relax and enjoy with your family.   A beautiful view of the river.  Good for fishing also.

data.title: Good fishing spot
data.text: I grew up in Palm Bay and would ride my bike out to this point, break brush to get to the water, and have a great time with the exploration and fishing. I was very glad to see what the city has accomplished with this park. Very nice!

data.title: Hidden Treasure
data.text: Gorgeous view of river.   Beautiful greenery and foliage.  Nice walking path.   Quaint pavilion.   Picnic area.   Amply parking.   Delightful visit.

data.title: Nice park
data.text: Nice park to take as breeak from all the daily hustle and bustle! Can stroll out on the nice docks ov rlooking the river

data.title: Stop by and relax.
data.text: We really enjoy going here. My husband fishes while I read a book and chill somewhere along the water. Plenty of shade on hot days with a pavilion and rest room. Picnic friendly and a  place to clean any fish caught.

data.title: Great view
data.text: Relaxing place with a great view of the Lagoon.  Even on the hottest days you'll find a breeze there.

data.title: Small park with lots of trees.
data.text: This is a quaint park filled with lots of trees, a small beach area and two fishing piers.  The pier offers a nice breeze which is great during the summer months.  There were a variety of birds and I spotted a dolphin off the pier.
